A significant cold weather system is expected to impact the Freeport area beginning tonight and continuing through early next week.What to expect:Freezing temperatures beginning tonight, with hard freezes expected Sunday night and Monday night, and another freeze possible Tuesday nightDangerous wind chills, especially with strong north windsFreezing rain possible late tonight through Sunday, which may create icy conditions on bridges, overpasses, and elevated roadsStrong winds (25&ndash;35 mph) may increase the risk of weather-related power outagesSome areas may remain below freezing for extended periods, allowing icy conditions to persistSafety precautions:Protect exposed pipes (drip faucets, open cabinets where appropriate)Bring pets indoors and protect sensitive plantsLimit time outdoors and dress in warm layersUse caution when traveling, especially late tonight and SundayCheck on elderly neighbors and those without adequate heatCity updates will be posted as conditions develop.

    • City of Freeport — Mayor & Council

    City of Freeport — Mayor & Council

    Freeport is led by a Mayor and four City Council Members, elected by neighborhoods (wards).

    Mayor Jerry Cain is the elected Mayor of the City of Freeport, Texas. He is committed to serving the community by supporting local growth, ensuring responsive city government, and working with residents, businesses, and regional partners to keep Freeport moving forward.

    The City Council meets on the first and third Monday of each month at 6:00 p.m. in the Council Chambers at the Police Department. These meetings are open to the public, and everyone is encouraged to attend.

    The Council hires a City Manager to oversee daily operations and also appoints the City Attorney, Police Chief, Municipal Judges, and volunteers who serve on boards and commissions.

    Want to learn more or contact your representatives? Click on the picture of any Council Member to view their bio and contact information.

    Council Member Ward D

    Winston Rossow

    (979) 233-3526

    wrossow@freeport.tx.us

    April 4, 2023

    I graduated from Brazosport High School in 1971 and was drafted into the Army, later serving three years in the Marine Corps. I worked for Dow Chemical for seven years and then spent 21 years with the Brazoria County Road and Bridge Department.

    My love for Freeport led me to run for City Council, where it’s an honor to serve our citizens.

    This year marks 23 years as Pastor of the Miracle House of Prayer. My wife, Debra, and I have been married for 42 years. We serve Freeport with honesty and integrity.

    The City of Freeport Texas
